birth_place.zh-cn: 日本摄津国大坂堂岛新地五丁目中津藩藏屋敷
birth_place.en: Nakatsu Domain Kurayashiki, Dōjima-shinchi 5-chome, Ōsaka, Settsu Province, Japan

death_place.zh-cn: 日本东京府东京市芝区三田二丁目
death_place.en: 2-chōme, Mita, Shiba-ku, Tokyo City, Tokyo Prefecture, Japan

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期启蒙思想家、教育家、庆应义塾大学创立者，对明治维新运动影响深远，被誉为“日本近代教育之父”。
description.en: A Japanese author, writer, teacher, translator, entrepreneur and journalist who founded Keio University. He was an early advocate for reform in Japan and is regarded as one of the founders of modern Japan.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉的父亲，丰前国中津藩的下等武士和儒学家。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi's father, a lower-ranking samurai and Confucian scholar of the Nakatsu Domain in Buzen Province.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户时代末期的兰学和医学家，创办了兰学私塾“适塾”。
description.en: A Japanese physician and scholar of Rangaku in the late Edo period, founder of the Rangaku private school Tekijuku.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末的政治家与军事家，曾担任咸临丸的指挥官。
description.en: A Japanese statesman and naval engineer during the late Edo period, who served as the commander of the Kanrin Maru.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治及大正时期的政治家，福泽谕吉的盟友。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji and Taishō periods, and an ally of Fukuzawa Yukichi.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰经济学家和哲学家，被誉为“经济学之父”，其自由市场经济理论影响了福泽谕吉。
description.en: A Scottish economist and philosopher, known as 'The Father of Economics', whose theories on free-market economy influenced Fukuzawa Yukichi.

description.zh-cn: 由福泽谕吉创立的日本著名私立大学，前身为兰学塾。
description.en: A renowned private university in Japan founded by Fukuzawa Yukichi, which originated as a school for Dutch studies.

description.zh-cn: 由绪方洪庵创办的兰学私塾，福泽谕吉曾在此学习并担任塾长。
description.en: A Rangaku private school founded by Ogata Kōan, where Fukuzawa Yukichi studied and later became the head of the school.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上最后一个武家政权，福泽谕吉曾受雇于幕府从事翻译工作并随其使节团出访欧美。
description.en: The last feudal government of Japan. Fukuzawa Yukichi was employed by the shogunate as a translator and accompanied its missions to the United States and Europe.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕府派遣的护卫舰，福泽谕吉曾作为军官助手搭乘此船于1860年横渡太平洋前往美国。
description.en: A Japanese naval warship dispatched by the Shogunate. Fukuzawa Yukichi served as an officer's assistant on board during its trans-Pacific voyage to the United States in 1860.

description.zh-cn: 由福泽谕吉于1882年创办的日报，旨在引导社会舆论。
description.en: A daily newspaper founded by Fukuzawa Yukichi in 1882 to guide public opinion.

description.zh-cn: 一个旨在促进亚洲团结和发展的日本组织。
description.en: A Japanese organization aimed at promoting Asian unity and development.

description.zh-cn: 中国最后一个帝制王朝，在福泽谕吉的《脱亚论》中被视为应与之“绝交”的“恶友”。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China, regarded by Fukuzawa Yukichi in 'Datsu-A Ron' as a 'bad friend' with whom Japan should break ties.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜半岛历史上的一个王朝，在福泽谕吉的《脱亚论》中被视为应与之“绝交”的“恶友”。
description.en: A Korean dynastic kingdom, regarded by Fukuzawa Yukichi in 'Datsu-A Ron' as a 'bad friend' with whom Japan should break ties.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家。
description.en: An East Asian country.

description.zh-cn: 北美洲国家。
description.en: A country in North America.

description.zh-cn: 日本在19世纪末期进行的政治和社会改革运动，使日本走向现代化，福泽谕吉是该运动重要的思想推动者。
description.en: A political and social revolution in late 19th-century Japan that led to its modernization. Fukuzawa Yukichi was a key intellectual promoter of this movement.

description.zh-cn: 清朝与日本之间的战争，福泽谕吉将其描述为“文野之战”并支持日本开战。
description.en: A war between the Qing dynasty and Japan, which Fukuzawa Yukichi described as a 'war between civilization and barbarism' and supported Japan's engagement in it.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜开化党人发动的政变，福泽谕吉曾出资购买武器予以资助。
description.en: A coup d'état initiated by pro-Japanese reformers in Joseon Korea, which Fukuzawa Yukichi supported by funding the purchase of weapons.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉的代表著作，提倡学习现代科学知识以实现个人和国家的独立，在当时日本影响巨大。
description.en: A representative work by Fukuzawa Yukichi that advocates for the study of modern scientific knowledge to achieve individual and national independence, which had a huge impact in Japan at the time.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉发表于《时事新报》的著名社论，主张日本应脱离亚洲，与西方文明国家为伍。
description.en: A famous editorial published by Fukuzawa Yukichi in 'Jiji Shinpō', arguing that Japan should break from Asia and align with Western civilized nations.

en: An Outline of a Theory of Civilization

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉的代表著作之一，系统性地阐述了他的文明观。
description.en: One of Fukuzawa Yukichi's representative works, which systematically elaborates on his theory of civilization.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉介绍西方国家状况的著作，对日本普及西学起到了重要作用。
description.en: A book by Fukuzawa Yukichi introducing the conditions of Western countries, which played a significant role in popularizing Western studies in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 江户时代日本通过荷兰语学习西方科学技术的学问，是福泽谕吉早年学习的核心。
description.en: The body of knowledge developed by Japan through its contacts with the Dutch enclave of Dejima, allowing Japan to learn about Western technology and medicine in the Edo period. It was the core of Fukuzawa Yukichi's early studies.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户时代的等级森严的社会制度，福泽谕吉对此持批判和反对态度。
description.en: The hierarchical social system of Japan's Edo period, which Fukuzawa Yukichi criticized and opposed.

description.zh-cn: 日本城市，福泽谕吉的出生地。
description.en: A city in Japan, the birthplace of Fukuzawa Yukichi.

description.zh-cn: 世界七大洲之一，福泽谕吉曾随使节团访问。
description.en: One of the seven continents, which Fukuzawa Yukichi visited as part of a diplomatic mission.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉是福泽百助的次子。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi was the second son of Fukuzawa Hyakusuke.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉出生于摄津国大坂堂岛。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi was born in Dōjima, Ōsaka, Settsu Province.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉反对并激烈抨击封建社会的身份等级制度和专制压抑。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi opposed and fiercely criticized the status system and authoritarian oppression of the feudal society.

description.zh-cn: 1855年，福泽谕吉前往绪方洪庵的适塾学习兰学，并于1857年成为塾长。
description.en: In 1855, Fukuzawa Yukichi went to Ogata Kōan's Tekijuku to study Rangaku, and became the head of the school in 1857.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在绪方洪庵的适塾中学习兰学，是其学生。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi studied Rangaku at Ogata Kōan's Tekijuku, being his student.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉于1858年在江户设立的兰学塾是庆应义塾的前身，他被认为是庆应义塾大学的创立者。
description.en: The Rangaku school established by Fukuzawa Yukichi in Edo in 1858 was the predecessor of Keio Gijuku, and he is considered the founder of Keio University.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉曾受雇于江户幕府，从事政府公文的翻译工作，并随幕府使节团出访海外。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi was employed by the Edo Shogunate to translate government documents and accompanied its missions abroad.

description.zh-cn: 1860年，福泽谕吉作为军官木村芥舟的助手，乘坐咸临丸前往美国。
description.en: In 1860, Fukuzawa Yukichi traveled to the United States aboard the Kanrin Maru as an assistant to officer Kimura Yoshitake.

description.zh-cn: 在1860年乘坐咸临丸前往美国期间，福泽谕吉与该船的指挥官胜海舟同行。
description.en: During the voyage to the United States aboard the Kanrin Maru in 1860, Fukuzawa Yukichi was accompanied by the ship's commander, Katsu Kaishū.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉于1882年创办了日报《时事新报》。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi founded the daily newspaper 'Jiji Shinpō' in 1882.

description.zh-cn: 大隈重信被描述为福泽谕吉的盟友。
description.en: Ōkuma Shigenobu was described as an ally of Fukuzawa Yukichi.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉通过其教育和著述活动，极大地影响和推动了明治维新运动，传播西方思想，倡导“文明开化”。
description.en: Through his educational and literary activities, Fukuzawa Yukichi greatly influenced and promoted the Meiji Restoration by disseminating Western ideas and advocating for 'Civilization and Enlightenment'.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在《时事新报》上发表了社论《脱亚论》，倡导日本脱离亚洲、学习西方文明。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi published the editorial 'Datsu-A Ron' in the Jiji Shinpō, advocating for Japan to leave Asia and learn from Western civilization.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在其《脱亚论》中对清朝持蔑视态度，视其为“恶友”，主张与其绝交。
description.en: In his 'Datsu-A Ron', Fukuzawa Yukichi held a contemptuous attitude towards the Qing dynasty, regarding it as a 'bad friend' and advocating for breaking ties.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在其《脱亚论》中对朝鲜王朝持蔑视态度，视其为“恶友”，主张与其绝交。
description.en: In his 'Datsu-A Ron', Fukuzawa Yukichi held a contemptuous attitude towards the Joseon dynasty, regarding it as a 'bad friend' and advocating for breaking ties.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉将中日甲午战争描述为一场“文野之战”，并支持日本对华开战。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi described the First Sino-Japanese War as a 'war between civilization and barbarism' and supported Japan's decision to go to war with China.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉通过出资购买武器来资助朝鲜改革派发动的甲申政变。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi supported the Gapsin Coup, initiated by Korean reformers, by funding the purchase of weapons.

description.zh-cn: 1880年，福泽谕吉担任兴亚会的顾问。
description.en: In 1880, Fukuzawa Yukichi served as an advisor to the Kōakai.

description.zh-cn: 绪方洪庵是兰学私塾“适塾”的创办人。
description.en: Ogata Kōan was the founder of the Rangaku private school, Tekijuku.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在《劝学篇》中多次提及亚当斯密的自由市场经济论，其经济思想受到其影响。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi repeatedly mentioned Adam Smith's free-market economic theory in 'An Encouragement of Learning', indicating his economic thought was influenced by it.

description.zh-cn: 《劝学篇》在当时的日本几乎人手一本，对日本的“文明开化”产生了巨大影响。
description.en: 'An Encouragement of Learning' was so popular in Japan at the time that nearly everyone had a copy, having a profound impact on Japan's 'Civilization and Enlightenment'.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉1860年访问美国，这次经历让他受到文化震撼，并深刻认识到学习英语和西方制度的必要性。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi's visit to the United States in 1860 caused him culture shock and made him profoundly aware of the necessity of learning English and Western systems.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉1862年访问欧洲，考察了医院、银行、议会等制度，痛感在日本普及西学的重要性。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi's visit to Europe in 1862, where he observed institutions like hospitals, banks, and parliaments, made him feel the urgent importance of popularizing Western learning in Japan.
